content: just try it by stitchnerd designs yarn works well with most yarns - particularly good for showing off handspun click on the yarn ideas or projects tabs on the just try it pattern page on ravelry for more ideas smaller single loops approx 200m 220 yds larger single loop approx 300m 330 yds you could double the stitch numbers of the regular or large sizes to make a double loop the regular size doubled would be tight up against the neck the larger size would be looser you probably wouldn t need to make it as deep so you d need slightly less than double the amount of yarn yarn requirements are estimates and will vary stitchnerd gift of grace handspun on 4 5mm us 7 according to the actual size you make needle you ll need a circular needle max 80cm/30 long the needle should be shorter than the circumference you want to knit - if the needle is not too long you ll get a nice flow as you knit if it s longer you ll have to keep adjusting - blog link for what to do http //stitchnerd blogspot be/2011/01/tip-too-few-stitches-for-your-circular html gauge you can use the sizing table as a rough guide to the number of stitches to cast on but if you want a precise size you ll need to swatch and check your gauge against the gauge in column 2 - you may need to change needle size you can also adjust the stitch numbers to get a different size you can adjust the height of the cowl to suit your taste or the amount of yarn you have available abbreviations k = knit p = purl st s = stitch es © ashcroft-hempsall 2013 - for personal non-commercial use only just try it 2 sizing table more info on pg 1 - if you want to adjust use a multiple of 7 yarn weight gauge needle tighter regular large single loop double loop per size guy size single loop approx 85cm/33 versions 10cm/4 approx approx for the version 55cm/22 66cm/26 with increases see tighter bottom edge note below fingering/sock 18 sts 4mm us 4-6 91 119 140 see note on 120 + increases page 1 dk 16 sts 4 5 - 5mm us 7-8 84 112 133 only for 114 + increases regular or large worsted/aran 14 sts 5 - 6 mm us 8-10 70 98 119 sizes not the 102 + increases tighter one the cast-on edge will flare out slightly as you knit and when worn on the smaller sizes i find this good for covering the top of the chest and getting it over the head tighter bottom edge i d only recommend this for the large single loop or for a double loop you can cast on a multiple of 6 stitch counts are indicated for the large loop work the first round as k5 pfb and then work the other rounds as k5 p2 making the cowl cast on
